title: Devify Blog: Backend Web Development
excerpt: Backend web development is becoming increasingly critical with the need for interactive websites making access to information more efficient alongside data processing, especially in the realm of e-commerce. Various popular services including Amazon, Netflix, and Google leverage artificial intelligence to advance initiatives...
content:
Backend Web Development
Backend Web Development

Backend web development is becoming increasingly critical with the need for interactive websites making access to information more efficient alongside data processing, especially in the realm of e-commerce. Various popular services including Amazon, Netflix, and Google leverage artificial intelligence to advance initiatives.

For Google, their backend systems publish search results based upon a user’s location, interests, and a variety of factors related to websites, heavily emphasizing design. It’s not uncommon to see Google’s analytics service to be included in many websites and it’s often hard to stay away from them. Their systems work by using JavaScript to submit data to their services which is then stored inside of a database for view later by webmasters and analysis by the company – often leading up to targeted advertising.

With the power of backend web development being laid upon programming languages such as PHP, JavaScript (server-side, such through node.js), Java, Ruby, and more, it’s permitting shared hosting to thrive.

Just recently, cPanel increased pricing to not only be based upon the amount and type of servers it was installed on, but also now the number of users using a server. With their monopoly over the website control panel industry, it’s hard to escape and causing many businesses to raise prices. cPanel is an application which manages a web server’s software through backend programming languages and can even manage the languages themselves with the power of CloudLinux such through PHP and Node.js version selectors and even Python.

Evidently, it’s necessary for web developers to expand their skill sets and acquire some background in backend web development to become more competent in the industry.

title: Devify Examples: CSS background-color Property
excerpt: The background-color CSS property can be applied to change the color behind content. It accepts HEX, RGB, RGBA, HSL, and HSLA values, standard color names, and the following...
content:
The background-color CSS property can be applied to change the color behind content. It accepts HEX, RGB, RGBA, HSL, and HSLA values, standard color names, and the following:
transparent:Sets the background transparent.
initial:Sets the property to its default value based on the browser.
inherit:Uses the background-color property of the container's parent element.

title: Devify Examples: HTML iFrame
excerpt: iFrames allow the display of other pages both internal and external. Alongside the standard, iFrames support the following attributes in HTML5...
content:
iFrames allow the display of other pages both internal and external. Alongside the standard, iFrames support the following attributes in HTML5:
name:Specifies a name for the iframe.
sandbox:Sets restrictions for content in an iframe.
src:Specifies the source URL.
srcdoc:Sets HTML content of the page to display in an iframe.
width:Sets the width of an iframe.
While managing iframes, note that some websites do not permit the hotlinking of them due to security reasons. Generally, this can be fixed using a local proxy, however may not be efficient or properly handle all requests.

title: Devify Frequently Asked Questions
excerpt: Why is Web Design Important? Website developers help make the internet easier to navigate and thereby help spread information. With this information, people can make more informed decisions alongside spread their ideas to help the world...
content:
Why is Web Design Important?

Website developers help make the internet easier to navigate and thereby help spread information. With this information, people can make more informed decisions alongside spread their ideas to help the world.

Designers have been raking in more and more money on average and with the rise of more information technology companies, this trend is bound to continue.

Should I learn Website Development?

Nearly everyone in the computer programming should get some basics in website development as often times backend languages such as Java and Python interact with the frontend and especially languages such as PHP and JavaScript.How do I get started?

For many, it's often best to simply analyze other websites. GitHub provides a variety of open source examples which are made to be read by other developers and future developers. You can begin by simply modifying existing works or using snippets of them in your own and learn on your way with an objective on what to create.

For others, it may be ideal to enroll in a course designed to slowly expose materials such through your local technical college or an online platform supplemented by Devify.

title: Devify Learn: Home
excerpt:
Learn With Devify
What is HTML?...
content:
Learn With Devify
What is HTML?

HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language. While many people believe it is, HTML is not a programming language and instead a framework. Parsing of HTML is dependant on the renderer's browser, however it is generally based on standards by the W3C.

It is used in front-end website development, making interacting with programs in the back-end such as those written with PHP or JavaScript (typically node.js) easier.

It uses the .html file extension, however older systems may use .htm with uniform three character file extensions.
What is CSS?

CSS is a stylesheet language which generally accompanies HTML. It stands for cascading style sheet and rendering is based upon standards, however is not uniform.

It uses the .css file extension.

title: Devify Legal: Privacy Policy
excerpt: This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data.
content:
Privacy Policy



Effective date: November 21, 2019



Devify ("us", "we", or "our") operates the https://gtc.jaysonfong.us/cist1510/final/ website (the "Service").



This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data.



We use your data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, accessible from https://gtc.jaysonfong.us/cist1510/final/

Information Collection And Use



We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you.

Types of Data Collected

Personal Data



While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you ("Personal Data"). Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to:



    Cookies and Usage Data



Usage Data



We may also collect information how the Service is accessed and used ("Usage Data"). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.

Tracking and Cookies Data



We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and hold certain information.



Cookies are files with small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Tracking technologies also used are beacons, tags, and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service.



You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service.



Examples of Cookies we use:



    Session Cookies. We use Session Cookies to operate our Service.

    Preference Cookies. We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings.

    Security Cookies. We use Security Cookies for security purposes.



Use of Data



Devify uses the collected data for various purposes:



    To provide and maintain the Service

    To notify you about changes to our Service

    To allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so

    To provide customer care and support

    To provide analysis or valuable information so that we can improve the Service

    To monitor the usage of the Service

    To detect, prevent and address technical issues



Transfer Of Data



Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to — and maintained on — computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ than those from your jurisdiction.



If you are located outside United States and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to United States and process it there.



Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer.



Devify will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organization or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information.

Disclosure Of Data

Legal Requirements



Devify may disclose your Personal Data in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to:



    To comply with a legal obligation

    To protect and defend the rights or property of Devify

    To prevent or investigate possible wrongdoing in connection with the Service

    To protect the personal safety of users of the Service or the public

    To protect against legal liability



Security Of Data



The security of your data is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Service Providers



We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service ("Service Providers"), to provide the Service on our behalf, to perform Service-related services or to assist us in analyzing how our Service is used.



These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.

Links To Other Sites



Our Service may contain links to other sites that are not operated by us. If you click on a third party link, you will be directed to that third party's site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site you visit.



We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services.

Children's Privacy



Our Service does not address anyone under the age of 18 ("Children").



We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 18. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your Children has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from children without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers.

Changes To This Privacy Policy



We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.



We will let you know via email and/or a prominent notice on our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update the "effective date" at the top of this Privacy Policy.



You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

Contact Us



If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:



    By mail: 5150 Sugarloaf Pkwy, Lawrenceville, GA 30043
